title: MS Dhoni praises Virender Sehwag on Twitter after former teammate retires from international cricket and IPL
text:
MS Dhoni praises Virender Sehwag on Twitter after former teammate retires from international cricket and IPL By India.com Sports Desk on October 20, 2015 at 4:16 PM Comments Indian Test skipper Mahendra Singh Dhoni has heaped praise on his former teammate Virender Sehwag after the latter announced retirement from international cricket and the Indian Premier league (IPL). Sehwag played under Dhoni when India won the 2007 ICC World T20 and the 2011 ICC World Cup. He announced his retirement on his 37th birthday. (Also Read: Virender Sehwag – A butcher with the bat, an affable simpleton without it ) Dhoni wrote on Twitter, “Didn’t see Viv Richards bat in person but I can proudly say I have witnessed Virender Sehwag tearing apart the best bowling attacks. Talent in batting is one thing but to have the mindset of Virupa in batting is as close to impossible as it can get. We keep saying be positive. Look for a single but he was one person who was always looking for a boundary. Many will try to play like you but my advice would b to enjoy you batting and be themselves. Congrats on a fantastic career.” Didn’t see Viv Richards bat in person but I can proudly say I have witnessed Virender Sehwag tearing apart the best bowling attacks 
— Mahendra Singh Dhoni (@msdhoni) October 20, 2015 
Fondly known as Veeru Paaji by teammates, Sehwag has played 104 Tests, 251 One-Day Internationals (ODI) and 19 T20 Internationals for India. He has also played for Delhi Daredevils and Kings XI Punjab in the IPL. Currently, he is playing for Haryana in Ranji Trophy 2015-16 and is likely to feature in Masters Champions League (MCL) to be held in Dubai next year. (Also Read: MS Dhoni retires from international cricket and IPL )
